entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

Create a new post

More info: Writing

Run server

More info: Server

Generate static files

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

More info: Deployment

entry.title: Test
entry.content:
1

In the EM algorithm for Bayesian Linear Regression:

y  ⟺  Xw  ⟺  Zα,β  ⟺  θ\bold{y} \iff X \\ \bold{w} \iff Z \\ \alpha, \beta \iff \boldsymbol\theta y⟺Xw⟺Zα,β⟺θ

As for the notation, NNN is the number of the data points, DDD is the number of attributes.

First, we assume y=wTx+ϵy=w^Tx+\epsilony=wTx+ϵ, where ϵ∼N(0,1β)\epsilon \sim N(0,\frac{1}{\beta})ϵ∼N(0,β1​). If we rewrite the data as X each ro corresponds to a data point, then

p(y∣w,X,β)=N(y∣Xw,β−1I)=1(2π)N/2∣β−1∣N/2exp⁡(−12β(y−Xw)T(y−Xw))p(y|w,X,\beta)=N(y|Xw,\beta^{-1}I) \\ =\frac{1}{(2\pi)^{N/2}|\beta^{-1}|^{N/2}}\exp(-\frac{1}{2}\beta(y-Xw)^T(y-Xw)) p(y∣w,X,β)=N(y∣Xw,β−1I)=(2π)N/2∣β−1∣N/21​exp(−21​β(y−Xw)T(y−Xw))

We define the prior of www as

p(w∣α)=N(w∣0,α−1I)=1(2π)D/2∣α−1∣D/2exp⁡(−12αwTw)p(w|\alpha)=N(w|0,\alpha^{-1}I) \\ =\frac{1}{(2\pi)^{D/2}|\alpha^{-1}|^{D/2}}\exp(-\frac{1}{2}\alpha w^Tw) p(w∣α)=N(w∣0,α−1I)=(2π)D/2∣α−1∣D/21​exp(−21​αwTw)

Assuming w,X,βw,X,\betaw,X,β are mutually independent,

p(y,w∣X,α,β)=p(y∣w,X,β)p(w∣α)∼N(w∣wN,VN)p(w∣X,y,α,β)∝N(w∣wN,VN)wN=βVNXTyVN−1=αI+βXTXp(y,w|X,\alpha,\beta) = p(y|w,X,\beta)p(w|\alpha) \sim N(w|w_N, V_N) \\ p(w|X,y,\alpha,\beta) \propto N(w|w_N, V_N) \\ w_N = \beta V_NX^{T}y \\ V_N^{-1}=\alpha I+\beta X^{T}X p(y,w∣X,α,β)=p(y∣w,X,β)p(w∣α)∼N(w∣wN​,VN​)p(w∣X,y,α,β)∝N(w∣wN​,VN​)wN​=βVN​XTyVN−1​=αI+βXTX

For EM algorithm, we first initialize αold,βold\alpha^{old}, \beta^{old}αold,βold.

E step:

p(Z∣X,θold)=p(y,w∣X,αold,βold)Q(θ,θold)=Ew∣X,y,αold,βold[ln⁡p(y,w∣X,α,β)]=E[ln⁡p(y∣w,X,β)]+E[ln⁡p(w∣α)]=N2ln⁡(β/2π)−β2E[(y−Xw)T(y−Xw)]+D2ln⁡(α/2π)−α2E(wTw)p(Z|X,\theta^{old})=p(y,w|X,\alpha^{old},\beta^{old}) \\ Q(\theta, \theta^{old})=E_{w|X,y,\alpha^{old},\beta^{old}}[\ln{p(y,w|X,\alpha, \beta)}]\\ =E[\ln{p(y|w,X,\beta)}] + E[\ln{p(w|\alpha)}] \\ = \frac{N}{2}\ln(\beta/2\pi)-\frac{\beta}{2}E[(y-Xw)^{T}(y-Xw)]+\frac{D}{2}\ln(\alpha/2\pi)-\frac{\alpha}{2}E(w^Tw)\\ p(Z∣X,θold)=p(y,w∣X,αold,βold)Q(θ,θold)=Ew∣X,y,αold,βold​[lnp(y,w∣X,α,β)]=E[lnp(y∣w,X,β)]+E[lnp(w∣α)]=2N​ln(β/2π)−2β​E[(y−Xw)T(y−Xw)]+2D​ln(α/2π)−2α​E(wTw)

M step:

θnew=arg⁡max⁡θQ(θ,θold)\theta^{new} = \arg \max_{\theta} Q(\theta, \theta^{old}) θnew=argθmax​Q(θ,θold)

To generate βnew\beta^{new}βnew, we can set \frac{\part Q(\theta, \theta^{old})}{\part \beta}=0

\frac{\part Q(\theta, \theta^{old})}{\part \beta} =0 \\ \beta^{new} = \frac{N}{E_{w|X,y,\alpha^{old},\beta^{old}}[(y-Xw)^T(y-Xw)]}

Let ϵ=y−Xw\boldsymbol{\epsilon}=\bold{y}-X\bold{w}ϵ=y−Xw, where ϵ∼N(y−XwN,XTXVN)\boldsymbol{\epsilon}\sim N(\bold{y}-Xw_N, X^TXV_N)ϵ∼N(y−XwN​,XTXVN​)

E[(y−Xw)T(y−Xw)]=E[ϵTϵ]=E[(ϵ−E(ϵ))T(ϵ−E(ϵ))+E(ϵ)TE(ϵ)+2(ϵ−E(ϵ))TE(ϵ)]=E[(ϵ−E(ϵ))T(ϵ−E(ϵ))]+E(ϵ)TE(ϵ)=E[Trace((ϵ−E(ϵ))T(ϵ−E(ϵ)))]+E(ϵ)TE(ϵ)=Trace[XTXVN]+(y−XwN)T(y−XwN)E[(y-Xw)^T(y-Xw)] = E[\boldsymbol{\epsilon}^{T}\boldsymbol{\epsilon}] \\ =E[(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}))^T(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}))+E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon})^TE(\boldsymbol{\epsilon})+2(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}))^TE(\boldsymbol{\epsilon})] \\ =E[(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}))^T(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}))]+E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon})^TE(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}) \\ =E[Trace((\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}))^T(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}-E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon})))]+E(\boldsymbol{\epsilon})^TE(\boldsymbol{\epsilon}) \\ =Trace[X^TXV_N]+(\bold{y}-Xw_N)^T(\bold{y}-Xw_N) E[(y−Xw)T(y−Xw)]=E[ϵTϵ]=E[(ϵ−E(ϵ))T(ϵ−E(ϵ))+E(ϵ)TE(ϵ)+2(ϵ−E(ϵ))TE(ϵ)]=E[(ϵ−E(ϵ))T(ϵ−E(ϵ))]+E(ϵ)TE(ϵ)=E[Trace((ϵ−E(ϵ))T(ϵ−E(ϵ)))]+E(ϵ)TE(ϵ)=Trace[XTXVN​]+(y−XwN​)T(y−XwN​)

Thus

βnew=NTrace[XTXVN]+(y−XwN)T(y−XwN)\beta^{new} = \frac{N}{Trace[X^TXV_N]+(\bold{y}-Xw_N)^T(\bold{y}-Xw_N)} βnew=Trace[XTXVN​]+(y−XwN​)T(y−XwN​)N​

Where wN=βoldVNXTyw_N = \beta^{old} V_NX^{T}ywN​=βoldVN​XTy and VN−1=αoldI+βoldXTXV_N^{-1}=\alpha^{old} I+\beta^{old} X^{T}XVN−1​=αoldI+βoldXTX.

2

There are at most kNk^NkN ways to partition NNN data points into clusters, so there are finite possible assignments. For each iteration of the algorithm,

  1. if the old assignment of centroids is same as the new, then the next clustering will keep same
  2. if the new assignment has lower distortion measure than the old one, then the old assignment will be replaced by the new one.

Since there is a finite number of possible assignments, each assignment has a unique minimum parameter of μk\boldsymbol{\mu}_kμk​, the K-meas algorithm will converge after a finite number of steps, when no re-assignment of data points will reduce the distortion measure. Also, if there are no different new assignment, μk\boldsymbol{\mu_k}μk​ will keep unchanged.

3

Goal: θMAP=arg⁡max⁡θp(θ∣X)=arg⁡max⁡θp(X∣θ)p(θ)\boldsymbol{\theta}_{MAP}=\arg \max_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}{p(\boldsymbol{\theta}|X)}=\arg \max_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}{p(X|\boldsymbol{\theta})p(\boldsymbol{\theta})}θMAP​=argmaxθ​p(θ∣X)=argmaxθ​p(X∣θ)p(θ)

  1. Choose an initial setting for the parameters θold\boldsymbol{\theta}^{old}θold, and assume a prior p(θ)p(\boldsymbol{\theta})p(θ)

  2. E step:

    Evaluate p(Z∣X,θold)p(Z|X,\boldsymbol{\theta}^{old})p(Z∣X,θold)

    QMAP(θ,θold)=EZ∣X,θold[log⁡p(X,Z∣θ)+log⁡p(θ)]=EZ∣X,θold[log⁡p(X,Z∣θ)]+log⁡p(θ)Q_{MAP}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\boldsymbol{\theta}^{old})=E_{Z|X,\boldsymbol{\theta}^{old}}[\log{p(X,Z|\boldsymbol{\theta})}+\log p(\boldsymbol{\theta})] \\ =E_{Z|X,\boldsymbol{\theta}^{old}}[\log{p(X,Z|\boldsymbol{\theta})]}+\log p(\boldsymbol{\theta}) QMAP​(θ,θold)=EZ∣X,θold​[logp(X,Z∣θ)+logp(θ)]=EZ∣X,θold​[logp(X,Z∣θ)]+logp(θ)

  3. M step:

    θnew=arg⁡max⁡θQMAP(θ,θold)\boldsymbol{\theta}^{new}=\arg \max_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}Q_{MAP}(\boldsymbol{\theta}, \boldsymbol{\theta}^{old}) θnew=argθmax​QMAP​(θ,θold)

  4. Check for the convergence of either the log posterior probability or the parameter values. If the convergence criterion is not satisfied, then let

    θold←θnew\boldsymbol{\theta}^{old}\leftarrow \boldsymbol{\theta}^{new} θold←θnew

    and return to step 2.
